resources.string: Someone with the Triangulation Device wants to connect to you!
Triangulation Device is an interactive sound artwork that generates improvised soundscapes between two people.\n\nVersion: 1.0

Jessica Thompson is an Assistant Professor in Hybrid Practice at the University of Waterloo. Her practice investigates spatial and social conditions within urban environments through interactive art-works situated at the intersection of sound, performance and mobile technologies.

Triangulation Device was produced through the generous support of the Lois Claxton Humanities and Social Sciences Endowment Fund, University of Waterloo

Research Assistants: Richard Lesco, Ram Sharma, and Chris Vandevelde (Systems Engineering), Jason Cho (Global Business and Digital Art)

Download the Triangulation Device onto your Android phone.

To create a soundscape with one user, open the project and press 'start'. The device will begin generating a soundscape based on your location, movement and gesture.

To create a collaborative soundscape, press 'find other devices' to link up with other users in your area. The soundscape will be generated between your locations, and can be modified by movement, gesture, or by sliding the scroll bar up and down.

To save your soundscapes, press 'stop' and 'save'.
Do you want to send an anonymous copy of your sessions to our server, for research and analysis of how people use Triangulation Device? No identifiable information will be sent.
